text: Blacksky started the way most good things do—with curiosity and a blinking cursor.

Before there were bootcamps or YouTube tutorials, there was a kid in an 8th grade computer lab, teaching himself to code on an Apple IIe. When the lab wasn't available, a $35 Radio Shack computer filled the gap. Then came the Commodore VIC-20. Then the C64. Each machine a new universe to explore.
That obsession never faded. It just evolved.

Eighteen years ago, that curiosity became a company. Blacksky LLC was founded on a simple premise: technology is craft. It should be built with intention, precision, and respect for the people who use it.

Today, Blacksky serves federal agencies and Fortune 500 companies—organizations where failure isn't an option. Treasury. NIH. FDA. Vanguard. Mastercard. Systems that serve millions and handle mission-critical data.
Blacksky. It's the moment before dawn. The blank terminal waiting for input. The darkness that makes stars visible.
It's potential—quiet, vast, and ready.
We've been building in that space for nearly two decades. Still curious. Still coding. Still obsessed with getting it right.

Mario Moorhead is the founder and principal architect of Blacksky LLC. With 18+ years of enterprise development experience, active federal security clearances, and a background spanning UX design to distributed systems architecture, he brings a rare combination of technical depth and design sensibility to every project, not nothing he is also a musican.
We architect enterprise platforms for organizations where failure isn't an option.

Federal agencies like Treasury, NIH, FDA, DOT, OSHA, SEC, FSIS, and HHS. Fortune 500 companies like Vanguard, Mastercard, and Blue Cross Blue Shield. Systems that serve 50M+ users and handle mission-critical data.
Our work spans the full stack:

› Cloud infrastructure (Azure, AWS, GCP)
› Distributed systems and microservices
› API design and integration
› AI/ML solutions and implementation
› Complex data migrations
› Search architecture (Solr, Elasticsearch)
› Container orchestration (Kubernetes)
We've led 15+ large-scale platform modernizations:

› SharePoint to Drupal
› Adobe CMS to Drupal
› Monoliths to microservices
› Legacy PHP to enterprise CMS
› On-premise to cloud-native
Design matters. Not just visual design, but system design. The elegance of an API. The clarity of a data model. The efficiency of a deployment pipeline.
We believe beautiful code leads to reliable systems.

We're skeptical of hype and allergic to buzzwords. When we adopt new technology—whether it's Kubernetes, AI, or the framework of the moment—it's because we've tested it, understood it, and determined it actually solves a problem. Technology for its own sake is waste.
The systems we build affect real people.

A platform at Treasury touches the financial infrastructure of the nation. An FDA system affects drug safety. An NIH portal supports medical research. A DOT dashboard tracks $100M+ in infrastructure projects.
This isn't abstract—it's responsibility.
We believe technology should serve democracy, not just commerce.

Our flagship civic project, Poly Sci Fi, reflects this commitment—a platform designed not for political division, but for accountability, giving everyday citizens the tools to engage meaningfully with their elected officials.
Real-time congressional data. Voting records. Committee assignments. All 535 members of Congress, accessible and searchable.
Blacksky believes technology should empower people, not just corporations.
We believe that the same AI capabilities transforming business can transform civic life: making government more transparent, participation more accessible, and democracy more responsive.
Technology is never neutral—we choose to build tools that make society more equitable, informed, and engaged.
While we build AI solutions for enterprises and federal agencies, our deeper mission is using technology to strengthen democracy and civic participation.
Blacksky values civic technology initiatives and prioritizes projects that create positive social impact alongside business value.
